sentence.Network_en: Perhaps we did acquire a somewhat fuddy-duddy image in the later years.
sentence.Network_cn: 可能在后来的几年里我们真的让人感到有些古板。

sentence.Network_en: Vanessa - Mae and her acolytes reduce the fuddy - duddy factor . Kids can relate.
sentence.Network_cn: 陈美与她的跟进者让古典音乐不再那么古板, 青少年可以认同.

sentence.Network_en: His students think that professor Jones is an old fuddy - duddy.
sentence.Network_cn: 琼斯教授的学生认为他是一个老顽固.

list.abs: Professor Jones is an old fuddy - duddy ., 琼斯教授是一个老古董.
you're such an old fuddy-duddy !你这个老古董！

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent. (originally dialect): of unknown origin

entry.def: If you describe someone as a fuddy-duddy, you are criticizing or making fun of them because they are old-fashioned in their appearance or attitudes.

example.ex: He didn't want all those old fuddy-duddies around.
example.tran: 他不想身边有那么多老古董。

auth_sentence.content: British fuddy-duddiness over matters of fish tended to get her particularly grumpy.

auth_sentence.content: Has The Times style changed, or am I becoming an old fuddy duddy?

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Has The Times style changed, or am I becoming an old fuddy duddy?

auth_sentence.content: I work with fashionable young women,...so I don't want to appear an old fuddy-duddy.
